description.S1: Eva Chartrand's home is on Byzantium.
description.S2: Lilya gave you a keycard to the front door.

blurb.B1: Head to Dr. Chartrand's house in Byzantium within the Estate District and use the Byzantium Estate Key to open the door and enter Dr. Chartrand's Home.
blurb.B2: Once inside, use the terminal to read her logs and notes,
blurb.B3: some of which talk about you checking the lab terminal on Cascadia and your takeover of HS-1084.
blurb.B4: Use the same terminal to open the lab and head down the elevator.
blurb.B5: Head forward and speak to Dr. Eva Chartrand.
blurb.B6: You can tell her that Lilya Hagen sent you to kill her,
blurb.B7: and she will say she does not know Lilya (if you bring her up) or wonder if you were sent by The Board.
blurb.B8: You can Lie (1) to her to get her to tell you what she is doing,
blurb.B9: which is finding a new way to feed the colony,
blurb.B10: as the crops that humanity brought from Earth are not reacting well to the local soil and are not giving humans the needed nutrients to survive.
blurb.B11: She will tell you that the colony will starve unless she can alter humans to thrive on the nutrients found in Halcyon,
blurb.B12: and will try to dissuade your fears that there is any alien takeover if you bring it up.
blurb.B13: She will also reveal that they didn't want to experiment on unwilling humans,
blurb.B14: so they instead experimented on each other,
blurb.B15: and will bring up the concerning fact that they contacted Earth about this years ago and never heard back.
blurb.B16: At this point two choices can be made.
blurb.B17: The Stranger could spare her letting her continue her research for the Board (this option increases Reputation with the Board),
blurb.B18: or ask her to work with Phineas Welles to help better mankind.
blurb.B19: She will not need convincing for either of these,
blurb.B20: but the Corporate Commander who guards will.
blurb.B21: If the Stranger has more positive Reputation with the Board than negative,
blurb.B22: they can bribe, Persuade (150) him into letting them go,
blurb.B23: or tell him they work for Adjutant Akande if they have completed at least one of her quests.
blurb.B24: Otherwise, if the Dumb or the last dialogue option is chosen,
blurb.B25: the UDL guards and the automechanichals will become hostile and the Stranger can either kill them gaining negative Reputation with the Board or run away.

description.S1: Lilya will want to know what happened at Dr. Chartrand's estate.
description.S2: She can be found at SubLight Headquarters on the Groundbreaker.

blurb.B1: Afterwards, report back to Hagen on the Groundbreaker for either the reward and some ship decorations in the Captain's quarters,
blurb.B2: or the dismissal from Sublight (along with a Reputation decrease),
blurb.B3: depending on whether or not Dr. Chartrand was killed.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: That's far enough. What are you doing here? How did you even get inside?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Lilya Hagen sent me to kill you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm the one asking the questions.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Your alien mind tricks won't fool me!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> Let's skip the talk and get to the good part.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hagen? Never heard of her. Is she from the Board? Damn it, I knew this would happen.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Lilya runs Sublight Salvage on Groundbreaker. Good boss. Bit of a live wire.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why would the Board want you dead?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Cut the distractions. I know all about your alien conspiracy.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: This is utter nonsense. I've never even been to Groundbreaker!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You've been to Cascadia. And Station Ten Eighty-Four. I know all of your dirty secrets.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> And you never will.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: What happened to the team? Tell me you didn't move their suspension tanks?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: SubLight took over the lab. Your human aquariums are probably just office decor.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Lilya has orders to airlock your sleeping friends if I don't report in.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> I'm done talking.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Small consolation. My team, the finest minds of their generation... reduced to salvage.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What were they trying to prove by experimenting on themselves?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: At least they're no longer accomplices to your alien conspiracy.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: We were trying to prove that the colony could survive the crisis bearing down on us.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Crisis? What crisis?

dialog.speaker: 0232_UDL_Commander (Male)
dialog.utterance: What are you doing, Doctor? This information is beyond classified.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: You can write me up in your report. It hardly matters.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm researching a new way to feed the colony. The crops we transplanted from Earth don't give us the nutrients we need. Our colonists might not realize it yet, but they're starving.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This is startling. But it doesn't explain the research I found.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Wait. You're telling me this was all about vegetables?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Do you always have corporate guards in your home?

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: The food we grow here barely sustains human life. The colony won't last under these conditions! So, the Board let me approach the problem from a different angle.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I believed that I could adapt humans to live on Halcyon's terms... that I could change us, give us the ability to derive sustenance from the nutrients the food *does* have.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Adaptation didn't save your research team.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: All you have to show for it is a lab full of preserved colleagues.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Hold on, what about the aliens?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> Let's see how quickly you can adapt to a bullet.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Not for lack of trying. I wanted to save them all, but I wasn't strong enough.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You burned through a lot of valuable scientists to arrive at zero solutions.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm surprised you don't have more support from the Board.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I wouldn't allow us to experiment on convicts or the unemployed. It's wrong, no matter what the law says. Everyone agreed. We accepted the risks.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm desperate. I've already asked all the best institutes on Earth for help. Years ago we sent a message out on the Cornelius Vanderbilt, but heard nothing back.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Enough talk. Where do we go from here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Isn't Cornelius Vanderbilt one of the assault cruisers patrolling Halcyon?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The Board wants to "adapt" the entire population of Halcyon?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's a hell of a story. Lilya Hagen still wants me to kill you.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: You could always shoot me. I assume that's why you're here.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: If I die, there's no one who can reproduce our work. Every sacrifice will have been for nothing. And we'll be no closer to a solution that feeds the colony.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You know Phineas Welles? If you work with him, I'll spare you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Keep working with the Board on a plan to save Halcyon. I'll leave you be.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> I can't let this go on. Sorry, Doc.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: The one on the wanted posters? They say he's an anarchist. A madman. A butcher.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'll do it.

dialog.speaker: 0232_UDL_Commander (Male)
dialog.utterance: Doctor!

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: What choice do I have, Commander?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That didn't take much convincing.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: In the future, try and stay away from plans that hack our species.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So there really is no alien conspiracy?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> Changed my mind.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: If working with Welles is the only way I can save the colony, then I will damn well do it!

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I need to get out of here. Phineas can contact me when he's ready to work together.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: For now, I had better pack up the lab and head somewhere discreet.

dialog.speaker: 0232_UDL_Commander (Male)
dialog.utterance: Not so fast! Captain, what you just learned is beyond your clearance. Hell, it's beyond mine.

dialog.speaker: 0232_UDL_Commander (Male)
dialog.utterance: Give me one reason why I should let you walk out of here alive.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Because the fate of the colony is in my hands.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What if I gave you <oeiglobal>Bribe_Amount</oeiglobal> reasons?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: It's less work than hauling my corpse out of here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> Can't think of one.

dialog.speaker: 0232_UDL_Commander (Male)
dialog.utterance: You sure have an inflated sense of self-importance. But that doesn't make you wrong.

dialog.speaker: 0232_UDL_Commander (Male)
dialog.utterance: Now move along. The Doc has a lot of work ahead of her. Tidying up and such.

dialog.speaker: 0232_UDL_Commander (Male)
dialog.utterance: That'll do. Sucker.

dialog.speaker: 0232_UDL_Commander (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wrong answer.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: What kind of scientist would I be if I held to a promise like that?

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Alien conspiracy? No. What? Did you hit your head on your way in or something?

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Oh, for pity's sake. I'll make sure you regret this!

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: You won't regret this. I'm still far from the breakthrough I need, but you're at least giving me a chance.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: It's been missing for over two years now. They never reestablished contact after the skip to Earth. Of course, the Board is keeping that under wraps.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: The Board is uneasy about letting the colony know, seeing as half of their military force vanished without a trace.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Lilya sent me after a conspiracy, but it looks like I found a cover-up instead.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Colonists might get unruly if they realized there was only one boot on their neck.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If the Board's authority is vulnerable, that's a crisis waiting to unfold.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> You've told me everything I need to know and more. Goodbye, Doc.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'd prefer if you didn't use my name when you talk about this. My contract has a list of very terrible consequences for breaking secrecy.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: The Board also has its brand to uphold. If you can't trust the brand, what else is there?

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Exactly. If colonists know we can't feed them or protect them, they'll begin to wonder why they need us at all.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Once we can replicate a success, the Board will move to rewire our nuclein. With any luck, our next generation will be eating and thriving off Halcyon crops.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: We haven't made enough strides to advance the plan. Hardly any at all. But we have to keep trying.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: There are other teams. We didn't want to experiment on human test subjects, so we used the only resources we had. Each other.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I know. I was there. Thomas was the first to take the gas. A simple test, he said. I told him not to, but he insisted.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: We learned a lot from his autopsy. Enough that we could try it on each other and know when to stop. No one else died! I must find a cure, so his sacrifice isn't in vain.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Look around. We're the only intelligent aliens in Halcyon.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Our produce might get us through the day, but we're getting weaker as a species. And sicker.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: A recent development, Captain. Apparently someone's broken into the laboratories where I used to work. The Board wanted me... protected.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: My WHAT conspiracy?

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Let's talk about this. Please. I think there's been a crucial misunderstanding.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm listening.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The alien theory did seem a little far-fetched.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> I'm done talking.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: If you came looking for some elaborate scheme... it isn't here. All I'm doing is trying to keep Halcyon alive.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: Just give me a second to explain myself. If you still want to shoot me, at least it'll be for an accurate reason.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'll tell you everything, just don't hurt them! Too many people have been harmed on my account.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: To keep me quiet. But if you didn't know that, I'm guessing they didn't send you.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: I always assumed they would put a bullet in my head one of these days. I don't know anyone named Hagen.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: You're in MY house, and I'm not fucking around. Start talking.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I came to blow the lid off your alien conspiracy.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> I hate negotiating.

dialog.speaker: EvaChartrand (Female)
dialog.utterance: My WHAT?
